title.narrative: Novel Lures for Pest Fruit Flies

description.narrative: Tropical fruit flies (Tephritidae: Dacinae) are among the world’s worst pests of fruits and vegetables. Male lures are used as part of their management, but around half of all dacine fruit flies do not respond to the known male lures, including several pest species in PNG. Recent research in Australia has led to the discovery of zingerone as a highly attractive male lure. Several other potential novel male lure compounds and host volatiles hold promise. The objectives of this study are to identify male lures and host volatile lures attractive to pest species that are not known to respond to male lures, to develop a strategy for further research, and to develop a methodology for incorporating the most promising lures in pest monitoring programs.
